  • Description: UPON PLACING THE CONTAINER ON THE IRREG BELT, THE IRREG DUMPER NOTICED A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID ON THE CART. AFTER STOPPING THE BELT, HE ALSO NOTICED THAT THE CONTAINER WAS LEAKING. DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS CONTACTED, AND WHEN CONTAINER WAS INSPECTED, A SMALL CRACK WAS FOUND ON THE CONTAINER.

item.title: Report X-2024020666
item.description:
Report X-2024020666

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-25
  • City: CITY OF INDUSTRY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was found leaking in the unload 1. The package was placed in a proper hazmat bag and the floor/rollers were cleaned of the liquid that spilled out. DescribePack: Upon opening the box, it was viewed that the cap and plastic seals that close the liquid inside the container were loose. One container was slightly open, so it caused the internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Spill was cleaned up properly and the leaking hazmat was taken to the hazmat cage to be processed.

item.title: Report X-2024020396
item.description:
Report X-2024020396

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-19
  • City: FAIRFIELD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package appeared to be packed in a stable box yet one of the four bottles had been punctured on its side in the box spilling its contets in the box. We contained the leaking box using PPE gear and put in a Hazmat bin for inspection. DescribePack: The plastic bottle has a slit on the side middle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was put into Hazmat bag in a bin.

item.title: Report X-2024020382
item.description:
Report X-2024020382

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upper surface of external packaging was wet and emitted a chemical odor. Item was removed from the sort stream and placed into a plastic lined container for inspection. DescribePack: The weld seams on both cans were cracked, approximate length of fracture was 1 cm. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up using absorbent materials. The rest of the shipment was placed into a plastic lined container and removed from the discovery site.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG DISCOVERED ON TRAILER LEAKING. PKG TAKEN TO HMPA FOR INSPECTION. INSPECTION FOUND 3 CANS OF PAINT WITH LIDS AJAR AND NO PAINT CLIPS CAUSING INTERNAL LEAKAGE. DescribePack: LIDS AJAR, BODY DENTED DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: LEAKAGE SOAKED UP WITH GRANULAR ABSORBENT. FANS TURNED ON AND NEAR BY BAY DOORS OPENED FOR VENTILATION

item.title: Report X-2024020313
item.description:
Report X-2024020313

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-13
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Arrived at the station with the side of the exterior already wet. Inside, under the molded foam, was 2 plastic containers of Athena Renew. DescribePack: One of the sealing cap was loose for about a quarter of a turn. This was enough for the liquid inside to spill. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Before the package was even unloaded, the package handler a noticed the box to be wet and immediately sent the phone in a plastic lined container and submitted it for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2024020510
item.description:
Report X-2024020510

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024020510 SequenceEvent: Package was been unloaded when it was noticed that the package was wet and was put into a hazmat bag and a tote on the side for inspection. DescribePack: 4 of the bottles had a lose cap causing it to leak and there was no inner packing for extra protection. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was quickly put into a hazmat bag and tote separated from the other packages were it could be taken away and inspected. 2. X-2024020511 SequenceEvent: Package was been unlo0aded when it was noticed that it was wet and needed to be inspected. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was found that the bottles had a lose cap which was the cause of the leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was quickly put in a hazmat bag and a tote and put into an isolated area to prevent any possible injuries. 3. X-2024020512 SequenceEvent: Package was been unloaded when it was noticed that the bottom part was wet, and it was put into a bag for protection. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was found that 1 of the 6 bottles had a lose cap which was the cause of the leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a bag and a tote been separated on a clear area where it could not caused aby damage or injuries.

INSPECTION FOUND 1 BOTTLE OF COIL CLEANER WITH A LOOSE CAP CAUSING INTERNAL LEAKAGE. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG BAGGED AND PLACED IN SALVAGE BIN. 2. DescribePack: LOOSE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG BAGGED IN HAZ BAG AND PLACED IN SALVAGE DRUM FOR LATER INSPECTION

item.title: Report X-2024020308
item.description:
Report X-2024020308

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • City: CARSON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by QA during the preload sort and declared damaged. Put inside hazmat liner and red tote to stop spilling. MSDS report obtained by shipper. SCMS was processed. Then taken to the hazmat processing cage and put inside a yellow bin. Total duration 1 hour. DescribePack: The bottles had a loose cap and spilled DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately put inside a lined red hazmat tote and processed accordingly.

item.title: Report E-2024020243
item.description:
Report E-2024020243

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: AZUSA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While offloading the trailer, a Veolia employee moved a drum inside a trailer by hand in order to align the drums so that he could grab the drums with drum grabber more easily. When he began to tilt one of the metal drums, he noticed that it was leaking from the bottom. He pushed the drum to its side to identify the leak and noticed multiple pin holes where material was leaking from. Due to the weight of the drum, the employee was unable to flip the drum by himself and sought assistance. With help, they were able to flipped the drum upside down to prevent further release of material from the drum. Approximately 30 gallons leaked out of the drum and into the unloading dock containment area. The damaged drum along with the 9 other drums from the same shipment were placed into a salvage drum. The leaked liquid inside the trailer was absorbed and the liquid in the containment area was pumped out. The day before it was raining, so when the employee went inside of the trailer he did not see any visible signs of dripping or stains to show a possible leak. Nor did the employee see any abnormalities/ deficiencies to the drum before moving it. The actual duration of the spill is unknown however, Veolia believes that the spill occurred after the time of receiving into the facility since there was no evidence of any spill at our transfer location.

  • City: FONTANA

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported approx 4 gallons of degreaser (UN1760) was released from four 1-gallon poly drums. The release impacted the trailer. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and it was decided they would clean the spill with PPE available at the terminal. (1) 30-gallon poly drum containing product only and(1) 30-gallon poly drum containing product-impacted oil dri and oil dri were created as waste and left for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024020169
item.description:
Report E-2024020169

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-09
  • City: ADELANTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: a spill was reported in Adelanto CA, due to improper loading at the previous terminal, a 50 LBS bag of phycomycin scp (UN3378) was damaged releasing 5 LBS of material into the trailer floor near the tail. ERTS obtained a product SDS and it was agreed that with proper PPE and procedures, it would be safe for the terminal to containerize the released material and the damaged bag for disposal. The terminal confined that the waste drum would be the product only with no other material. Only 1 bag will be held back. 5G DF - of Product only was created as waste and left for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024020114
item.description:
Report E-2024020114

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-27
  • City: W SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Patriot Environmental Services was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft- by-1ft area of the trailer floor and a 1ft-by-1ft area of the concrete parking lot and estimated that two (2) pounds of material was released due to load shift that damaged one (1) plastic bag. Patriot Environmental Services personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted areas and recovered the spent material. The impacted areas were then treated with a neutralizer. The spent material that was recovered was containerized into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum and the damaged 50-pound plastic bag along with the remaining product was placed into one (1) additional 15-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite until the waste profile has been completed and approved for transport for disposal.
